page.title: 02Historic Buildings
page.content:
Tudor Barn This early sixteenth century barn was originally an outbuilding of a large moated house which was demolished in 1733.The site is of Saxon origin and was occupied by Edith Nesbit from 1899- 1922.The red-brick two storey barn, together with the contemporary moat and bridge was purchased by Woolich Borough Council in 1931 and was restored.It is surrounded by beautiful grounds known as The Pleasance and is now used as a retaurant and art gallery.
Severndroog Castle. This folly-tower is situated in Jack Wood on Shooters Hill.It was designed by Richard Jupp in 1784,in memory of Sir William James,the adventurer of the Indian Ocean,who resided at Eltham Park.
